Module andrei.pt_30424_pelle_andrei_assignment_3
Package andrei.Controller

Class TableController<T>

java.lang.Object
andrei.Controller.TableController<T>
Type Parameters:
T - -> type for table
public class TableController<T> extends Object
This is the generic controller for the table. The table will be shown on this scene, alongside with the buttons for create/update/delete.

    • onCreate

      Throws:
      IOException

    • onDelete

      public void onDelete()
      The method will check if the user has made a selection. If not, an alert will be shown. Next, the user will be asked if they want to confirm their selection. If the user is sure about the deletion, a BLL will be requested and the call to delete will be given. This call cannot fail, thus no error checking is done.

    • addTableColumns

      public void addTableColumns() throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      This method generates the table header using reflection. Columns are added for each field in the object and the table sorting strategy is set to be sorted on id. Then, the method to populate the table with data is called.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      NoSuchMethodException
      InvocationTargetException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException

    • refreshTable

      public void refreshTable() throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Method will refresh table data with what is present in the database. A reference to business class is obtained and the table is populated using the findAll statement in the DAO. A call to TableView.setAll() follows which will populate the whole table using the objects generated by the findAll method.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      NoSuchMethodException
      InvocationTargetException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert()
      A generic alert telling the user that they haven't made a selection in the table before pressing edit or create.

    • setType

      public void setType(Class<T> targetClass)
      During the initialisation, the buttons are given a name based on the functionality and the target class that is being used.
      Parameters:
      targetClass - -> generic class used for name

    • getBLLReference

      public AbstractBLL<T> getBLLReference(Class<T> type) throws ClassNotFoundException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      This function wil dynamically search the logic package in order to find correct business logic class associated with the parameter. An abstract type will be returned, however the created object will be of type specific to the generic, not the abstract, so the called function will be desired ones thanks to run-time polymorphism provided by java.
      Parameters:
      type - -> type of the business logic class that is being searched
      Returns:
      -> business logic class of the required type
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      NoSuchMethodException
      InvocationTargetException
      InstantiationException
      IllegalAccessException
